name: N-{4-[(1E)-3-Oxo-3-phenylprop-1-en-1-yl]phenyl}acetamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1087
Reason: 1-ethyl-4-methylenepiperidine moiety may both add roughly +20 each due to adding more rigid ring structures and making the molecule more compact; The phenyl group introduces a rigid structure and additional molecular weight, estimated at +20. The oxo-functionalities and methylene-linked glycol structure can add roughly +30 each, and the moramide group (O=C(N1CCCC1)) includes functionalities related to amides, which can significantly increase the melting point due to hydrogen bonding, adding about +30. The methylene-linked glycol structure can also contribute to the melting point due to its ability to form intermolecular hydrogen bonds, estimated at around +10. The presence of a carbonyl group can also increase the melting point due to the potential for hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions, estimated at around +10.
